question: 1. What is the supreme law of the land?
2. What does the Constitution do?
answer:
sets up the government
defines the government
protects basic rights of Americans

question: 3. The idea of self-government is in the first three words of the Constitution. What are these words?
4. What is an amendment?
answer:
a change (to the Constitution)
an addition (to the Constitution)

question: 5. What do we call the first ten amendments to the Constitution?
6. What is one right or freedom from the First Amendment?*
answer:
speech
religion
assembly
press
petition the government

question: 7. How many amendments does the Constitution have?
8. What did the Declaration of Independence do?
answer:
announced our independence (from Great Britain)
declared our independence (from Great Britain)
said that the United States is free (from Great Britain)

question: 9. What are two rights in the Declaration of Independence?
10. What is freedom of religion?
answer: You can practice any religion, or not practice a religion.

question: 11. What is the economic system in the United States?*
12. What is the “rule of law”?
answer:
Everyone must follow the law.
Leaders must obey the law.
Government must obey the law.
No one is above the law.

question: 13. Name one branch or part of the government.*
answer:
Congress
legislative
President
executive
the courts
judicial

question: 14. What stops one branch of government from becoming too powerful?
answer:
checks and balances
separation of powers

question: 15. Who is in charge of the executive branch?
16. Who makes federal laws?
answer:
Congress
Senate and House (of Representatives)
(U.S. or national) legislature

question: 17. What are the two parts of the U.S. Congress?*
18. How many U.S. Senators are there? )
19. We elect a U.S. Senator for how many years?
20. Who is one of your state’s U.S. Senators now?*
answer: Answers will vary. [District of Columbia residents and residents of U.S. territories should answer that D.C. (or the territory where the applicant lives) has no U.S. Senators.]

question: 21. The House of Representatives has how many voting members?
22. We elect a U.S. Representative for how many years?
23. Name your U.S. Representative. Question 23 Audio (MP3, 423 KB)
answer: Answers will vary. [Residents of territories with nonvoting Delegates or Resident Commissioners may provide the name of that Delegate or Commissioner. Also acceptable is any statement that the territory has no (voting) Representatives in Congress.]

question: 24. Who does a U.S. Senator represent? Question 24 Audio (MP3, 157 KB)
25. Why do some states have more Representatives than other states? Question 25 Audio (MP3, 324 KB)
answer:
(because of) the state’s population
(because) they have more people
(because) some states have more people

question: 26. We elect a President for how many years? Question 26 Audio (MP3, 152 KB)
27. In what month do we vote for President?* Question 27 Audio (MP3, 157 KB)
28. What is the name of the President of the United States now?* Question 28 Audio (MP3, 374 KB)
answer: Visit uscis.gov/citizenship/testupdates for the name of the President of the United States.

question: 29. What is the name of the Vice President of the United States now? Question 29 Audio (MP3, 415 KB)
answer: Visit uscis.gov/citizenship/testupdates for the name of the Vice President of the United States.

question: 30. If the President can no longer serve, who becomes President? Question 30 Audio (MP3, 204 KB)
31. If both the President and the Vice President can no longer serve, who becomes President? Question 31 Audio (MP3, 233 KB)
32. Who is the Commander in Chief of the military? Question 32 Audio (MP3, 157 KB)
33. Who signs bills to become laws? Question 33 Audio (MP3, 159 KB)
34. Who vetoes bills? Question 34 Audio (MP3, 141 KB)
35. What does the President’s Cabinet do? Question 35 Audio (MP3, 164 KB)
36. What are two Cabinet-level positions? Question 36 Audio (MP3, 1.02 MB)
answer:
Secretary of Agriculture
Secretary of Commerce
Secretary of Defense
Secretary of Education
Secretary of Energy
Secretary of Health and Human Services
Secretary of Homeland Security
Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
Secretary of the Interior
Secretary of Labor
Secretary of State
Secretary of Transportation
Secretary of the Treasury
Secretary of Veterans Affairs
Attorney General
Vice President

question: 37. What does the judicial branch do? Question 37 Audio (MP3, 349 KB)
answer:
reviews laws
explains laws
resolves disputes (disagreements)
decides if a law goes against the Constitution

question: 38. What is the highest court in the United States? Question 38 Audio (MP3, 159 KB)
39. How many justices are on the Supreme Court? Question 39 Audio (MP3, 402 KB)
answer: Visit uscis.gov/citizenship/testupdates for the number of justices on the Supreme Court.

question: 40. Who is the Chief Justice of the United States now? Question 40 Audio (MP3, 430 KB)
answer: Visit uscis.gov/citizenship/testupdates for the name of the Chief Justice of the United States.

question: 41. Under our Constitution, some powers belong to the federal government. What is one power of the federal government? Question 41 Audio (MP3, 409 KB)
answer:
to print money
to declare war
to create an army
to make treaties

question: 42. Under our Constitution, some powers belong to the states. What is one power of the states? Question 42 Audio (MP3, 485 KB)
answer:
provide schooling and education
provide protection (police)
provide safety (fire departments)
give a driver’s license
approve zoning and land use

question: 43. Who is the Governor of your state now? Question 43 Audio (MP3, 240 KB)
answer: Answers will vary. [District of Columbia residents should answer that D.C. does not have a Governor.]

question: 44. What is the capital of your state?* Question 44 Audio (MP3, 375 KB)
answer: Answers will vary. [District of Columbia residents should answer that D.C. is not a state and does not have a capital. Residents of U.S. territories should name the capital of the territory.]

question: 45. What are the two major political parties in the United States?* Question 45 Audio (MP3, 190 KB)
46. What is the political party of the President now? Question 46 Audio (MP3, 375 KB)
answer: Visit uscis.gov/citizenship/testupdates for the political party of the President.

question: 47. What is the name of the Speaker of the House of Representatives now? Question 47 Audio (MP3, 411 KB)
answer: Visit uscis.gov/citizenship/testupdates for the name of the Speaker of the House of Representatives.

question: 48. There are four amendments to the Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them. Question 48 Audio (MP3, 468 KB)
answer:
Citizens eighteen (18) and older (can vote).
You don’t have to pay (a poll tax) to vote.
Any citizen can vote. (Women and men can vote.)
A male citizen of any race (can vote).

question: 49. What is one responsibility that is only for United States citizens?* Question 49 Audio (MP3, 265 KB)
answer:
serve on a jury
vote in a federal election

question: 50. Name one right only for United States citizens. Question 50 Audio (MP3, 242 KB)
answer:
vote in a federal election
run for federal office

question: 51. What are two rights of everyone living in the United States? Question 51 Audio (MP3, 427 KB)
answer:
freedom of expression
freedom of speech
freedom of assembly
freedom to petition the government
freedom of religion
the right to bear arms

question: 52. What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance? Question 52 Audio (MP3, 238 KB)
53. What is one promise you make when you become a United States citizen? Question 53 Audio (MP3, 579 KB)
answer:
give up loyalty to other countries
defend the Constitution and laws of the United States
obey the laws of the United States
serve in the U.S. military (if needed)
serve (do important work for) the nation (if needed)
be loyal to the United States

question: 54. How old do citizens have to be to vote for President?* Question 54 Audio (MP3, 179 KB)
55. What are two ways that Americans can participate in their democracy? Question 55 Audio (MP3, 681 KB)
answer:
vote
join a political party
help with a campaign
join a civic group
join a community group
give an elected official your opinion on an issue
call Senators and Representatives
publicly support or oppose an issue or policy
run for office
write to a newspaper

question: 56. When is the last day you can send in federal income tax forms?* Question 56 Audio (MP3, 184 KB)
57. When must all men register for the Selective Service? Question 57 Audio (MP3, 260 KB)
answer:
at age eighteen (18)
between eighteen (18) and twenty-six (26)

question: 58. What is one reason colonists came to America? Question 58 Audio (MP3, 391 KB)
answer:
freedom
political liberty
religious freedom
economic opportunity
practice their religion
escape persecution

question: 59. Who lived in America before the Europeans arrived? Question 59 Audio (MP3, 193 KB)
60. What group of people was taken to America and sold as slaves? Question 60 Audio (MP3, 220 KB)
61. Why did the colonists fight the British? Question 61 Audio (MP3, 356 KB)
answer:
because of high taxes (taxation without representation)
because the British army stayed in their houses (boarding, quartering)
because they didn’t have self-government

question: 62. Who wrote the Declaration of Independence? Question 62 Audio (MP3, 150 KB)

question: 65. What happened at the Constitutional Convention? Question 65 Audio (MP3, 244 KB)
answer:
The Constitution was written.
The Founding Fathers wrote the Constitution.

question: 66. When was the Constitution written? Question 66 Audio (MP3, 158 KB)

U.S. diplomat
oldest member of the Constitutional Convention

started the first free libraries

question: 69. Who is the “Father of Our Country”? Question 69 Audio (MP3, 139 KB)
70. Who was the first President?* Question 70 Audio (MP3, 141 KB)

question: 73. Name the U.S. war between the North and the South. Question 73 Audio (MP3, 241 KB)

question: 74. Name one problem that led to the Civil War. Question 74 Audio (MP3, 273 KB)

freed the slaves (Emancipation Proclamation)

question: 76. What did the Emancipation Proclamation do? Question 76 Audio (MP3, 387 KB)

freed the slaves
freed slaves in the Confederacy

question: 77. What did Susan B. Anthony do? Question 77 Audio (MP3, 235 KB)
